business.headline: ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

Who are Gensol's promoters Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi?According to Sebi's findings, both Anmol and Puneet are accused of misusing company funds. The market regulator claims that the promoters treated the company like their personal business.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares jumped 6% todayShares of IndusInd Bank were trading 5.51% higher at Rs 776.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) around 12:34 pm.

Over 3 million iPhones sold: Apple likely to post best-ever quarter in IndiaThe Q1 2025 number is a big jump from the 2.21 million iPhones sold in the same period last year. It shows how fast Apple is growing in India, a market that is becoming more important for the company every year.

Investment advisor warns against inflation: 'By 2030, you'll own less, pay more'Abhijit Chokshi stated in his post that most people think inflation means things getting expensive. But he explains that inflation has two faces. One is visible inflation and the other is invisible inflation.

PwC shuts down operations in more than a dozen countries: ReportThe decision was taken due to mounting differences with local partners. Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
IREDA share price jumps 6% after strong Q4 results. All you need to knowIREDA shares jumped sharply after strong Q4 earnings, though asset quality concerns could temper gains in the near term.

Gensol Engineering share price crashes to all-time low. Should you buy or avoid?The stock has now crashed 84% since the start of 2025 and is down nearly 87% over the past year, making it one of the worst-performing listed firms in the clean energy space.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

Sebi vs Jaggi brothers: What's in the interim order over wrongdoings?During its probe, the market regulator found 'blatant violation of rules of corporate governance' and 'alleged wrongdoings'.  It said that the promoters were running Gensol like a private firm.

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.

Government, Swiggy join hands to boost jobs in gig, delivery sectorThe government said the partnership with Swiggy would help take the National Career Service portal deeper into the gig economy space.

How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

Retail inflation eases further to 3.34% in March, lowest since August 2019The March CPI inflation print came in below February's 3.61%, marking the second straight month that inflation has stayed under the Reserve Bank of India's 4% medium-term target.

Hermes overtakes LVMH in market value years after takeover dramaWay back in 2010, LVMH's billionaire CEO Bernard Arnault shocked the corporate world by acquiring a huge stake in Hermes. It was seen as an effort to seize control of the company. But the Hermes family fought back. They came together to defend their brand and ultimately made Arnault sell his shares.

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Dalal Street dusts off Trump's April 2 tariff shock, stages full comebackTrading resumed after a long weekend, but there was no slowdown in terms of momentum. The Nifty50 climbed as much as 2.4% intraday, comfortably reclaiming its pre-tariff territory, while the Sensex gained over 1,600 points.

UPS vs NPS: Which pension scheme should you opt forThe Unified Pension Scheme is the new retirement scheme effective from April 1, 2025. It is for central government employees. If you're currently under NPS, you'll have the option to shift to this new plan.

This multibagger stock has given 13,000% return. Should you buy?Since its stock market debut on July 28, 2003, the company has delivered a return of nearly 12,951.78%. It touched its 52-week high of Rs 2,559.95 on September 4, 2024.

Adani Green share price jumps 5% today after Q4 business update. Check detailsThe stock rose as much as 5.33% in early trade to hit Rs 941.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 1:05 pm, the shares of the company were trading 4.17% higher at Rs 931.

USD vs INR: CA explains which one actually holds more valueCA Nitin Kaushik said that some people argue that salaries in India grow faster. Though he doesn't deny it, he questions whether that trend still holds true today.

Sensex, Nifty jump 6% in two sessions. Are Dalal Street bulls back on track?While the sharp rebound in equity markets has reignited investor enthusiasm, experts are urging caution amid ongoing global uncertainties, especially around the US trade policy.

'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.
Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market gain amid positive global cues?Stock market today: Trading on Dalal Street remained shut on Monday due to Ambedkar Jayanti. As trading resumes, investors are hopeful that the markets will continue their positive trend from Friday, when both Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 2%.

Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

Dr Reddy's asks several top-paid executives to quit in cost-cutting drive: ReportDr Reddy's Laboratories (DRL) FY24 annual report shows it had over 26,000 employees worldwide as of March 2024. That includes 21,757 permanent staff. In FY24, the company hired 6,281 people and spent Rs 5,030 crore on employee benefits,

entertainment.headline: Gene Hackman's wife Googled flu symptoms days before death: ReportAuthorities have revealed that Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife Betsy Arakawa, 65, died in their Santa Fe home from natural causes—Arakawa from rare hantavirus and Hackman from heart disease worsened by Alzheimer's. New details shed light on Arakawa's health concerns before her death and confirm no foul play was involved.

Did you know Jaideep Ahlawat was offered Vibhishan in Ranbir Kapoor's Ramayana?Ranbir Kapoor's 'Ramayana' is one of the most anticipated projects in Bollywood. But, did you know actor Jaideep Ahlawat was offered the role of Vibhishan in the Nitesh Tiwari directorial?

Babil on trolling for humility: It hurt when they got Baba involved | ExclusiveBabil Khan, son of the late actor Irrfan, often faces online trolling, with the video of him apologising to an actor for photobombing during a red carpet going viral. In an exclusive interview, he shared that lit hurt him one time when his father was also brought into the meme.

Jesse Eisenberg's starry musical film begins productionJesse Eisenberg's musical film, featuring Julianne Moore and Paul Giamatti, is now in production. Halle Bailey, Bernadette Peters, and Havana Rose Liu have also recently joined the cast.

Kichcha Sudeep's BRB: First Blood shoot starts, calls it unparalleled excitementKannada actor Kichcha Sudeep shared the news on X, about his highly anticipated upcoming film, 
Billa Ranga Basha: First Blood', directed by Anup Bhandari. The film is going on floors on April 16.

Actor Simbu sings powerful song in Pawan Kalyan's OG, confirms composerComposer Thaman revealed that Tamil star Simbu has already recorded the first single titled 'Firestorm' for the much-awaited action film 'They Call Him OG' starring Pawan Kalyan.

Sharvari to star opposite Ranveer Singh in Don 3 after Kiara Advani's exit: ReportActor Sharvari Wagh is reportedly set to join Ranveer Singh in Don 3. Kiara Advani stepped away from the project due to her pregnancy.

Katy Perry, Orlando Bloom's relationship timeline: From breakup to engagementKaty Perry and Orlando Bloom's relationship has spanned nearly a decade, filled with romantic milestones, a brief split, and the birth of their daughter, Daisy. Engaged since 2019, the couple remains together in 2025, continuing to build their bond through love, therapy, and shared parenthood.

Confirmed! Shiva Rajkumar all set to reprise his role in Rajinikanth's Jailer 2Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar, while interacting with the media at a press meet held in Hyderabad to promote his upcoming Kannada film 45, confirmed that he would be reprising his role from the first part in Rajinikanth's 'Jailer 2'.

Tiger zinda hai: Akshay Kumar defends Salman Khan amid Sikandar failureActor Akshay Kumar tried to reaffirm the audience's faith in Salman Khan's screen presence despite Sikandar's failure at the box office. The 'Kesari 2' actor called his friend a 'tiger' and an 'immortal' star.

Neha Kakkar shares pics with 'favourite people' amid ongoing rift with sister SonuNeha Kakkar stirred curiosity by posting cheerful photos with her husband Rohanpreet Singh and brother Tony Kakkar, amid an ongoing rift with sister Sonu. Fans questioned the absence of Sonu after she announced severing ties with her siblings due to emotional distress.

Malayalam, Marathi only industries delivering content: Mahesh ManjrekarVeteran filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar discusses the challenges faced by Marathi cinema despite its rich storytelling, highlighting the industry's struggle against big-budget Hindi films and the need for greater scale and reach.

Big B talks about importance of 'good sanskaar', value of time for new generationAmitabh Bachchan spoke about the significance of instilling 'good sanskaar' in the new generation. He emphasised the role of values and ethics in shaping the youth.

Renuka Shahane on Devmanus: Rare to find such simple yet powerful charactersRenuka Shahane returns to Marathi cinema with 'Devmanus', drawn by its compelling script and the unique simplicity of her character Lakshmi, whose spiritual journey anchors the narrative.

Adolescence season 2 in works? Actor Christine Tremarco answers | Exclusive 'Adolescence' actor Christine Tremarco discusses the show's ending and the uncertainty surrounding a potential second season in an exclusive interview with India Today/

Ananya Panday creates history as Chanel's first Indian brand ambassadorActor Ananya Panday attended the Chanel show at the Paris Fashion Week last year, and now, she has been announced as the first Indian brand ambassador of the French luxury brand.

AR Rahman breaks silence on recent health scare, personal life making headlinesAR Rahman discussed his recent health scare and the inspiration behind his upcoming 'Wonderment' tour in an exclusive chat with India Today. The music icon also reflected on personal life changes and the unwavering support from fans.

Sagarika Ghatge-Zaheer Khan become parents to baby boy, reveal nameActor Sagarika Ghatge and cricketer Zaheer Khan announced the birth of their son on Tuesday on Instagram. The couple shared a beautiful picture with their baby and also revealed his name in the caption.

It took Deepika Padukone for Ibrahim to realise his father Saif was 'big actor'Ibrahim Ali Khan got candid about growing up on film sets, and being raised by famous parents. In an interview recently, he talked about the moment he finally became aware of his father's popularity.

general news.headline: Undoing 'waqf by user' will have huge consequences: Top court's big remarksThe Supreme Court, hearing 73 petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment Act, said that denotifying the properties of the 'waqf by user', would have huge consequences, but stopped short of passing interim orders.

Trump calls Harvard a joke, says it has been hiring all woke teaching staffUS President Donald Trump ramped up his attacks on Harvard, claiming that the university "lost its way" and was no longer considered a "decent place" for learning.

Justice BR Gavai likely to succeed Sanjiv Khanna as next Chief Justice of IndiaJustice BR Gavai, if appointed, will become the 52nd Chief Justice of India. He is likely to take the oath of the top judicial chair on May 14.

US giant fires 200, mostly Telugus, over salary fraudUS mortgage giant, Fannie Mae, has laid off 200 employees, mostly Telugus, over salary fraud, according to a report. The employees allegedly misused the company's matching gift programme by collaborating with Telugu associations. An Indian-American Congressman has sought the company's response on the mass lay-offs.

Why jails in India are asking to be freedOver half of India's prisons are overcrowded, with 176 of them housing four times the number of inmates they were sanctioned to hold. Two prisons in Delhi's Tihar Jail have 400% occupancy. India's jails are bursting at the seams even as the proportion of undertrial inmates rises to 76% of all prisoners.

Will you allow Muslims on Hindu boards? Supreme Court questions Waqf compositionThe Chief Justice pointed out that as per the Act, eight members of the board are Muslims, and possibly only two are not. "Why not have non-Muslims also in the advisory board of Hindu endowments then?" he said.

Minor stripped, filmed by mother, her partner over disclosing their affairA minor girl was allegedly stripped and filmed by her mother and her mother's boyfriend because she disclosed their extramarital affair to the landlord.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

Low vitamin D affecting your sex life? New study links it to erectile dysfunctionVitamin D deficiency may cause erectile dysfunction by impairing blood flow and reducing drug effectiveness, a new study revealed.

PM should rein in Amit Shah: Mamata Banerjee claims violence was plannedMamata Banerjee, in a meeting with imams over the Waqf law, suggested a conspiracy by Amit Shah and the BSF to allow the entry of Bangladeshi miscreants to fuel unrest in Bengal.

India's first ATM on train launched on Mumbai's Panchavati ExpressPassengers of Panchavati and Janshatabdi Express can soon withdraw cash during their train journey. Indian Railways successfully tested the country's first ATM inside a train coach.
Pune's Rutuja Warhade bags Rank 3 in National Defence Academy, tops girls' listPune girl Rutuja Warhade has topped the NDA exam amongst female candidates and secured an overall All India Rank of 3.

Chronically tired: A misunderstood illness affecting more women than menChronic fatigue syndrome is a complex, under-recognised illness that disproportionately affects women, yet often goes undiagnosed or misdiagnosed.

Air hostess on ventilator sexually assaulted by hospital staff in Gurugram: CopsThe case came to light after the 46-year-old air hostess registered a complaint alleging that she was sexually assaulted by hospital staff while unconscious and on a ventilator.

Type 5 diabetes: A new disease affecting millions of kids worldwideThe new type 5 diabetes has often been misunderstood and wrongly grouped under type 1 or type 2 diabetes. With growing research, the disease has been given its own category.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

Woman drowns in Ganga at Uttarkashi's Manikarnika Ghat while recording videoA horrifying video of a woman being swept away in the strong currents of the Ganga river at Uttarkashi's Manikarnika Ghat has gone viral on social media.

Doctor's 'Indians take Dolo 650 like it is Cadbury Gems' post sparks meme festDr Palaniappan Manickam, a US-based gastroenterologist and health educator, said in a post on X that "Indians take Dolo 650 like it is Cadbury Gems".

Pune flour mill owner hangs 16 permits required to run small business on wallIn a now-viral post on X, a Pune-based chartered financial analyst (CFA) shared what he called "the best example" of the ease of doing business in India.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
A Bangla-dicey situation breathing down Chicken's NeckWest Bengal's borders have been a revolving door, spinning tales of migration, identity, and demographic shift.

Didi's imagination...: BJP mocks Mamata Banerjee for Bengal-Sri Lanka border gaffeThe BJP slammed Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over a geography blunder, mocking her claim that West Bengal shares a border with Sri Lanka.

Vellore waqf shocker shows why law didn't trigger CAA-like protestsThe arbitrary nature of land claimed as waqf properties was revealed in the notice served to 150 families in Tamil Nadu's Vellore by a mosque and dargah. Just a day earlier, PM Modi said how letters from Muslim widows triggered the waqf reforms. The arbitrariness of the claims, with even Muslims being victims, reveals why the anti-waqf law protests didn't take the shape or ferocity of the anti-CAA stir.

Set up prisons for officers to enjoy: Top court raps Telangana over tree fellingThe Supreme Court lashed out at the Telangana government over large-scale tree felling in Kancha Gachibowli. Stressing on environmental restoration, the top court held officials accountable after reports of forest destruction near Hyderabad sparked outrage.

sports.headline: NBA Play-in tournament preview: Mavericks vs Kings, Heat vs Bulls, schedule, how to watch & moreThe 2025 NBA Play-in tournament has begun. Two important matchups are set for Wednesday night, April 16. In the Western Conference, the Dallas Mavericks will face off against the Sacramento Kings in a win-or-go-home battle. While, the Chicago Bulls take on the Miami Heat in the Eastern Conference.

Jitesh Sharma enjoying finisher's role at RCB: Scores of 20,30 are my fiftiesJitesh Sharma revealed that he's enjoying finisher's role at the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and the scores of 20 and 30 are his new milestones.

NBA Playoffs: Los Angeles Lakers roster decided, full schedule and key matchup previewThe Los Angeles Lakers have officially finalized their roster heading into the 2025 NBA Playoffs. The Lakers finished the regular season with a strong 50-32 record and earned the No. 3 seed in the Western Conference.

That's a Batman, Jimmy Butler hails Stephen Curry as Warriors clinch Playoff spotIn a Western Conference NBA Play-in tournament matchup at Chase Centre on Tuesday, April 15, the Golden State Warriors survived a second-half comeback from the Memphis Grizzlies to claim a 121-116 victory and lock in the No. 7 seed for the NBA postseason.

Real Madrid vs Arsenal, UCL quarter-final 2nd leg: When and where to watchReal Madrid are known for historic Champions League turnarounds, and their clash against Arsenal at the Bernabeu is set up perfectly for another. But the Gunners, fresh off a first-leg thrashing, will look to spoil the party with composure.

Rohit Sharma backs ODI cricket's future: It has a different challengeRohit Sharma opened up about his enduring love for ODI cricket, underlining its unique challenge and long-standing importance, even amid the T20 frenzy. The India captain's Champions Trophy heroics only cemented his legacy in the 50-over format.

Gautam Gambhir agreed-not agreed: Rohit Sharma recalls drama before Sydney Test callSpeaking to Michael Clarke on a recent podcast, Rohit Sharma recalled his decision to sit out of the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney. The India captain discussed a conversation with coach Gautam Gambhir before making the big call.

Want me to say something silly? England star gives his take on IPL vs PSL debateEngland batter Sam Billings said the Indian Premier League is well ahead of the rest of the T20 leagues in the world. Billings has been playing for Lahore Qalandars in the 10th edition of the Pakistan Super League.

DC vs RR, Match preview: Can Delhi snap back against recovering Rajasthan?IPL 2025, DC vs RR Match Preview: Delhi Capitals will aim to return to winning ways after their unbeaten streak was snapped by Mumbai. Against a struggling Rajasthan Royals outfit, the Axar Patel-led side may look to experiment and regain control atop the IPL 2025 points table.

MS Dhoni 'greatest reader of the game': Dube's Bishnoi revelation thrills fansIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: Shivam Dube, speaking to the Super Kings, revealed that MS Dhoni had predicted Rishabh Pant would not use Ravi Bishnoi as long as the big-hitting left-hander stayed in the middle during their chase of 167. Dhoni and Dube anchored a successful chase for CSK in Lucknow on Monday, April 14.

Watch: Sunil Narine's bat fails size test during KKR's shock loss to PBKS in IPL 2025IPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders stars Sunil Narine and Anrich Nortje failed the mandatory bat size checks during their defeat to Punjab Kings in Mullanpur on Tuesday, April 15.

Gautam Gambhir agreed-not agreed: Rohit Sharma recalls drama before Sydney Test callSpeaking to Michael Clarke on a recent podcast, Rohit Sharma recalled his decision to sit out of the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney. The India captain discussed a conversation with coach Gautam Gambhir before making the big call.

Want me to say something silly? England star gives his take on IPL vs PSL debateEngland batter Sam Billings said the Indian Premier League is well ahead of the rest of the T20 leagues in the world. Billings has been playing for Lahore Qalandars in the 10th edition of the Pakistan Super League.

DC vs RR, Match preview: Can Delhi snap back against recovering Rajasthan?IPL 2025, DC vs RR Match Preview: Delhi Capitals will aim to return to winning ways after their unbeaten streak was snapped by Mumbai. Against a struggling Rajasthan Royals outfit, the Axar Patel-led side may look to experiment and regain control atop the IPL 2025 points table.

MS Dhoni 'greatest reader of the game': Dube's Bishnoi revelation thrills fansIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: Shivam Dube, speaking to the Super Kings, revealed that MS Dhoni had predicted Rishabh Pant would not use Ravi Bishnoi as long as the big-hitting left-hander stayed in the middle during their chase of 167. Dhoni and Dube anchored a successful chase for CSK in Lucknow on Monday, April 14.

Watch: Sunil Narine's bat fails size test during KKR's shock loss to PBKS in IPL 2025IPL 2025: Kolkata Knight Riders stars Sunil Narine and Anrich Nortje failed the mandatory bat size checks during their defeat to Punjab Kings in Mullanpur on Tuesday, April 15.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
